greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of k-ary heaps on n levels; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..9, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, k) option remember; local h, i, x, y, z;
if n<2 then 1 elif k<2 then k
if y<=z and z<=x then b(y, k)^(k-1-i)*
mathematica: multinomial[n_, k_List] := n!/Times @@ (k!); b[n_, k_] := b[n, k] = Module[{}, Which[n<2, 1, k<2, k, True, h = Log[k, (k-1)*n+1] // Floor; If[k^h == (k-1)*n+1, b[(n-1)/k, k]^k*multinomial[n-1, Array[(n-1)/k&, k]], {x, y} := {(k^h-1)/(k-1), (k^(h-1)-1)/(k-1)}; For[i = 0, True, i++, z = (n-1) - (k-1-i)*y - i*x; If[y <= z && z <= x, b[y, k]^(k-1-i) * multinomial[n-1, Join[Array[y&, k-1-i], Array[x&, i], {z}]]*b[x, k]^i * b[z, k]; Break[]]]]]]; A[n_, k_] := If[n<2, 1, If[k<2, k, b[(k^n-1) / (k-1), k]]]; Table[A[n, d-n], {d, 0, 7}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 24 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 28 2016
